title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: The Mackies' third guy.

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: The Mackies looked confused.

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: They slowed and stopped talking as they spotted the Mackies.

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: The Mackies slowed as they approached the highest point in the road.

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: He held her collar and scurried across the path, the Mackies still a good distance away.

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: There was a way up from Holyrood Park, the Mackies must've used that.

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: The Mackies.

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: And now the Mackies have taken Ryan Whitehouse.

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: Jamie Mackie getting shot, that dog getting killed, the Mackies' house burning down.

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: 'Dean Whitehouse torched the Mackies' home, so they kidnapped his nephew.'

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: 'The Mackies have kidnapped the Whitehouse kid,' he said.

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: 'The Mackies have taken Ryan,' Adele said.

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: 'When did the Mackies leave?'

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: 'What else did the Mackies say?

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: The Mackies.

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: What would the Mackies do?

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: 'You know what the Mackies did to that dog, don't you?'

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: There were plenty of the Mackies' type hanging around, zigzags in their hair, lurid gold chains, expensive chunky white trainers, muscles on show, air of arrogant cockiness.

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: Now, standing in front of the Mackies' torched home, he wasn't sure why he'd come.

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: Where do the Mackies live?'

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: 'He said he was going to deal with the Mackies once and for all.'

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: 'I can't imagine an associate of the Mackies, or a hitman or whoever, driving around in a small, ten-year-old hatchback, can you?

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: 'The police don't think the Mackies were responsible, at least not directly.

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: What about Dean and the Mackies?

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: 'The police aren't sure that the Mackies killed Frank,' Adele said.

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: 'The Mackies.'

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: The fucking Mackies.

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: They don't want psychos like the Mackies in charge of things, so they're showing solidarity with Dean, presuming he's going to take over the mantle.'

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: If I can nail the Mackies for Frank's death, and Dean Whitehouse for the Mackie shooting before I go, then I'll have done a pretty decent job of cleaning up the mess in this city.'

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: 'The Mackies are a whole new level of scum.

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: 'It could still be the Mackies though, couldn't it?'

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: I guess this could get the Mackies off the hook if the police can't find the car and link it to them, and if their alibis hold together.'

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: The Mackies have alibis, there's no news about Frank's whereabouts on the night, blah blah.

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: 'Yeah, the Mackies had the most to gain, rival criminal gangs and all that, and they're just about the only guys in town capable of something like this.'
